website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for those who aren't at home and want to maintain lawns using their cell phone and verbal controls.
pros: Adapts to home networks and allows for irrigation control in literally one click of a button
Weather Sense technology provides watering based on slope, soil type, sun and shade, and real-time weather feeds
We love the supportive customer service team as well

website_summaries.verdict: The Orbit B-hyve isn't the best smart sprinkler we've tested, but its reasonable price makes it the best budget-friendly option.
pros: The Orbit B-Hyve combines a classic look with well-implemented smarts
The app will watch the weather and schedule your sprinklers for you, and you can control your sprinklers with your voice through B-Hyve's Alexa skill
cons: The app could have used a few more scheduling options and a little more depth throughout
The manual controls can be confusing and the B-Hyve doesn't work with as many smart home partners as the competition

customer_reviews.title: Most affordable Smart Home Sprinkler Device on the Market. . . EASY TO USE!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this smart sprinkler device with some doubts since I asked for a RACHIO Smart sprinkler controller for Christmas last year, and that cost over $200! As I researched I found that this device can do everything the RACHIO can do for half the price. I needed some way to control the sprinklers at my rental property and so I thought I would risk spending the $95 for this device. I'm glad I did. I was totally "Blown-Away" at how easy the installation was and the WiFi set-up was easy as well. In my opinion, you can't go wrong with this purchase. WATCH MY VIDEO - For more DETAILS. Created by: twHomeShow.com
customer_reviews.author: ToddsWorld

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Orbit Customer Service! Do NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: My unit arrived broken. I called Orbit customer service and waited over 60 minutes for someone to take my call. The support representative told me to contact Amazon and that they could not help me. There is a slip of paper included with the unit that states, "Do not return the unit to the place of purchase and to contact customer support first." You have all seen those messages before so I was a bit surprised by them telling me to contact Amazon and offered no assistance. I give Orbit Zero Stars for such poor customer service so I cannot recommend anyone buy their products again. Horrible customer service! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: The product is probably good, but their customer service is pathetic
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble connecting to internet so I installed a WiFi extender. Still had a setup problem. I went on the "chat line" with Orbit's customer service and waited 1 hr 14 minutes before I gave up. I had my wife call their customer service number and she waited "on hold" for 1 hour 35 minutes before she gave up. The product is probably good, but their customer service is pathetic. If you want to be frustrated, try calling them or using their chat line. When you can not service appropriately products that you sell, you will soon find that people will refuse to buy them. And more importantly the good name of "orbit" will be diminished.
customer_reviews.author: David A Sherman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CONCEPT......TERRIBLE EXECUTION!!
customer_reviews.text: Same connection frustrations as others have mentioned. Will NOT connect by following instructions included in box or the instructions on the mobile app. After a fifty minute wait on the phone, I finally got a real live customer service rep who informed me that you have to do the initial setup via BLUETOOTH instead of WiFi. NOWHERE in the written or app instructions is this little detail even mentioned. So..... you probably guessed that the device wouldn’t connect via Bluetooth either! While we were attempting to troubleshoot the problem, the line suddenly went dead! People, I don’t need this irrigation controller enough to put up with this kind of crap. It’s going back in the AM PRONTO!
customer_reviews.author: wbr

customer_reviews.title: The unit looks nice, but mine died after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The unit looks nice, but mine died after 2 weeks. Besides that the programming is huge, but did not have the way I like to set it up. Instead of A,B,C, I just want to time my zones like: zone 1, 60m days 1,2,3,4,5,6,7 .....zone 2, 30m days 1,3,5 etc ... or whatever. This unit does not do that. Its not the units fault... I am limited on water produced by an RO system that gives me 800 gallons a day. I need to really adjust my zones in minutes and days the way I like it... this unit does not allow me to. And if it dies .... it does not do anything. Back to Rainbird :)
customer_reviews.author: Jorgen

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, especially for the price. Does everything I need and the one button set and forget nature of it was a relief. Installed very easily and connected to my home network without any problems. So far been a couple months and I still show off to people how I can turn my sprinklers on and off remotely from anywhere (I'm easily entertained). I've easily convinced at least two other people to buy one of these. Very much recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: My Wi-Fi signal is very weak (56% on router, 1-bar on unit) so I thought this would have a hard time working correctly but it's been fine so far. Pros: -controlling the sprinklers from the sprinkler head without having to walk back-and-forth to the timer. - successfully set the entire thing up from my iPhone. (Haven't use the controls on the actual unit yet) As far as I can tell there's no reason to walk out to the timer box ever. -really useful features. (Rain delay, manual control, scheduling.) -coolness factor is high. -price at the time ($86) was an amazing deal. Con: "Smart" features are really dumb. Smart or recommended watering schedule is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: The WORST user interface I have encourtered
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap. The timer is nearly impossible to program. I long to back to our old manual Rainbird control unit, which I unfortunately threw out. Setup and programming are difficult to the point of being impossible. The wireless (cell phone) interface does not work. We tried to use the rain delay setting, which is supposed to pause the watering schedule for the number of days selected. We paused it for 3 days. A 10 days later it was still paused for 3 days! We bought this at something like half off. I suspect the manufacturer was dumping bad product. I will never buy another Orbit product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Gitter

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Smart
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace my non wifi controller. The basic functions of the controller and wifi work well. The phone app seems to work without major issues. Now the problems: The smart watering feature doesn't work. I have changed zip codes, disabled rain sensor, and the unit will randomly just quit scheduling. The rain delay seems to require constant clearing. I have become frustrated dealing with the Orbit support group with the smart watering issues. One person i spoke with actually told me not to use the smart watering due to known problems. If you need a basic reasonably priced wifi controller, this fills the bill. If you're trying to use the smart features look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Died within 30 minutes of powering up....wow
customer_reviews.text: I got all my zones connected, then powered it on. The first part of the setup seemed fine until I got to wifi setup. I tried to connect wifi for about 30 minutes, then the screen stopped showing anything, and the mobile application no longer saw the device. Unbelievable.... I proceeded to troubleshoot the device by resetting, pulling the backup battery, the comms cable, no luck. I am within the 30-day return period. I'm not going to try again with this controller.
customer_reviews.author: riza

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. It’s been nonstop problems from the get go. The software is extremely buggy, the support is aweful, and the “smart” features are about as dumb as it gets. I’ve spent at least 50 hours trying to tweak this thing to work at least reasonably well, and cannot. It’s junk.
customer_reviews.author: M&ROlsen

customer_reviews.title: Constant WiFi issues
customer_reviews.text: I have numerous items in my home & none have an issue with my router. At least 90% of the time this unit will not connect. I purchased it as an upgrade. It offers WiFi, Alexa & several other bells & whistles that my previous timer lacked. Wish I hadn’t thrown away my previous manual timer (16 yrs old but still functioning). Back to the drawing board researching other brands because I’m tired of this nonsense. This one is definitely going back! Thankfully I purchased it via Amazon Prime!
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Really works well, easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Orbit B-hyve sprinkler controller I have purchased and installed. The installation is straight forward. One hint is to take a picture of the wiring on the controller you are replacing so you get the terminal connections right on the B-hyve. The programming is done on your smart phone from which you can also override programs, adjust programs, run a single or multiple zone manual cycle or just turn the sprinkler off. So far its been very reliable. One hint, before you purchase any Wi-Fi sprinkler controller use your smart phone to verify that you have adequate network signal strength (two bars minimum) at the controller.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Received a non-working unit. Support is very minimal ...
customer_reviews.text: I picked this unit based on the plethora of good reviews. When the unit arrived, I began installation, plugging it into a fully working power socket. No matter what I tried the screen just read NO AC ... I tried the online support recommendations (reset the unit and re-plug it in) -- did not work. I tried calling a human to support and waited for about an hour to have someone tell me to reset the unit and re-plug it in. Returning this unit and buying the competing higher priced product. Hopefully will get support even if I don't get a perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: wifi disconnects too often
customer_reviews.text: This could be such a great controller. Unfortunately it loses its wifi connection ...a lot! You spend too much time trying to get it to connect again. The solutions aren't good either. Often you have to power the unit down, or reset it, which means going through the setup process again, ...and again. I specifically made sure I had a strong signal to the device before I got it. Doesn't matter. They have lots of complaints about this on their forum too (which I hadn't seen).
customer_reviews.author: Archimedes

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2, one died in 3 months and other loses wifi all the time
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first one in October 2018, worked well for 3 months and then went stupid. Display just scrolls through all settings as if it was scrambled. Pulled the plug for 15 seconds, held Reset button down and plugged it back in again - didn't help. Removed the 3V button battery and repeated unplug/reset, and it started working again. For one day. Have tried variations on the above for a week now and still goes scrambled. Other one works but loses the wifi connection about every couple days or so. First one never did lose wifi, even after power outages, but that is the only thing on it that does work. Doesn't water the grass at all.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hudspeth

customer_reviews.title: more complex than it should  be
customer_reviews.text: MUCH easier to operate than any other controller I’ve had.(3). I like it. Having said that the app is not as user friendly as it could be. For instance you can program your sprinklers to come on at the same time twice in one day how is that possible? Setting zone times while easy once you play with it awhile takes some learning to do. Editing should be much easier. I AM HOWEVER VERY OLEASED WITH THIS CONTROLLER! I looked forward to micro managing the zones and adding programs. Like i.e. blowout system for winter program.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Update, should have updated earlier. Device is back to oerational
customer_reviews.text: After some back and forth emails with manufacturer - I was able to hard -reset the device. It turned communication on back to original. So why wouldn't manufacturer add the magic reset instruction to original troubleshooting manual? Original review: Not even one year passed - this device is junk. Not even full year passed since I bought it. Lost connection to server and refuses to re-connect. In same rom with router!!! Times out after 2 minutes attempts. Tried with iPhones 6S, 8 and X all result are the same.
customer_reviews.author: Vad Beren

customer_reviews.title: Better alternative to dumb sprinkler timer
customer_reviews.text: The on-device screen and UI is just confusing and frustrating as other orbit dumb sprinkler controller. But the app makes everything multiple times better. The UI of the app still needs some refining, but scheduling is mischief easier. Alexa, google home integration works great. I wish it also had IFTTT support, but that’s minor issue for me. I haven’t dived into smart watering feature. It’s default config seem to be too aggressive with water saving. But it let you config a lot of parameters. Overall, much better than dumb timer. It is much cheaper compare to other smart timer. And still this probably is sufficient for most people.
customer_reviews.author: Afknoob

customer_reviews.title: Blank screen after 6 months, product is unusable, switched back to old system.
customer_reviews.text: Troubleshooted using orbit website blank screen web page, nothing is working. created a ticket, they also send the same troubleshooting details from their website, and requested when did I purchase this product, after that no communication, sent so many followups. but no one responded. switched back to old manual system. waste of money, support does not fix the issues less than a year product. do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Raghav

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: After spending $100 to buy, and about 2 hours on a Sunday installing this thing, I plug it in and nothing happens. Long story short, after another hour trying to diagnose, I have to wait until Monday morning to call customer support. After more time on the phone, they tell me "the transformer is no good, please return it". Now I get to undo all my work, repackage and return. I will avoid ORBIT brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal

customer_reviews.title: To bad
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I checked out and bought the"used, like new" version. My bad! but I've bought "used like new" before. And very happy to do so. But this unit was alerted you couldn't open the compartment where the wiring is terminated, because they crammed the transformer into where it doesn't fit. So this obstructed the door from opening. So I figured I would still try to use it, cause I need it for my garden. I have the eero pro while home Wireless mesh system for my wifi. It works withboth 2.4 or 5 Ghz devices. I tried to many times I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Santos Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Reliability
customer_reviews.text: Original unit worked for about a week then started dropping WiFi and occasionally freezing up. Only power cycling to reset unit solved issue. Firmware update by Orbit customer support did not help. Then received replacement unit from Orbit under warranty. Again, lasted about 1 week before same symptoms began. Dropping WiFi, freezing up, skipped watering cycles. Requires frequent power cycle (unplugging and plugging back in) to keep it operational. I'm done with Orbit Bhyve. Going back to my foolproof simple digital irrigation timer.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: This unit has it all - Wifi, Alexa, Google Home, and iPhone/Android controls=FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: Very Easy Setup on your iPhone or Android, Simple Wifi, voice activation with Amazon Alexa Echo device and Google Home features. I enabled the skill for Alexa and Google Home and now have voice controls of irrigation when I feel like it. You could spend more on another make (Raxxxx) but then ask yourself WHY... The reviews on this B-Hive/Orbit work great. I'm very happy with all the controls in the palm of my hand and the schedule works PERFECTLY. Overall, I'm very satisfied!!!
customer_reviews.author: Outside Man

customer_reviews.title: The Orbit 57950 advertised as a 12 zone system comes shipped as an 8 Zone  system
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to be able to control my 12 zone sprinkler system from an ios app. Unfortunately, out of its box, mine is an 8 Zone system with no instructions on how to make it work with 12 zones. Attempts to have a help line program it correctly have failed. I will be returning this product. Hopefully, this priblem will be corrected because there is not anything else on the market with the advertised capability un this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Frank N. Meacher

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up. Ran once. Now it’s dead or playing dead.
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a dream system. The set up was easy and flawless and the customizations are amazing. Five star product if only it worked! After all the successful tests and after running just one time, the device is frozen and nothing I try has fixed it. I did some searching online and this seems to be a common problem that requires someone from the company having to remotely log in to your device. Once frozen there is no way to manually override so you can water your plants. I’m glad I didn’t chuck my old system because this product is crap.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy, just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly one of the easiest smart devices I have ever set up. Super intuitive, just easy. Best controller in my opinion, does everything from your phone. Had it connected 10 minutes and I love it. Tip for some of the less tech savvy, hook it up like a normal sprinkles controller. Then do everything else from you phone, and make sure you're within reach or your 2.4ghz wifi band, doesnt work off 5ghz. Use you phone to set up the wifi on the controller, piece of cake. Best part is in Cali you get an $80 rebate 😁👍
customer_reviews.author: Joe Duenes

customer_reviews.title: 12 Station only allows 4 programs as of 10/2018
customer_reviews.text: 12 station controller can only have 4 programs. So if you actually have 12 stations then you'll need to combine them into 4 programs. Not ideal and had I known that i would have looked more at other options. If they fixed that and allowed for 12 programs for 12 stations then it's a 5 star product to me. (I would suspect it's a software update away, but it may never happen) The interval timing option was also a reason I picked it. I don't have any desire to use the water saving functions, just want a programmable irrigation controller. If you can live with 4 programs then it's a great controller.
customer_reviews.author: BDS

customer_reviews.title: Well built SMART sprinkler controller system
customer_reviews.text: Orbit 57950 B-hyve Indoor/Outdoor 12-Station WiFi Sprinkler System Controller is a very well built SMART sprinkler controller system. It's easy to install. WIFI and App setup are straight forward. I really like the App capability of testing new or replacement sprinkler heads without having walked to the sprinkler controller unit to turn on/off. It is also very convenient for me to change the watering schedule on the App when I travel and repair lawn. Have been using for the past two months and do not have any problems. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to adjust watering schedules on my phone
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It's compact, water resistant, and very easy to use. Pairing to wifi is a piece of cake. Then you just plug your sprinkler wire in and then open up the app. The app lets you configure your zones, and has very capable options to make simple or complex schedules. It's also weather-aware so it will automatically delay watering if rain is expected. When setting up sprinklers it is amazingly helpful to be able to pull out your phone and start/stop the zone you're working on. Or to be laying in bed and start/stop a watering schedule. The app is surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: BE AWARE!!!! Read before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: Look for another product if you care about the WiFi technology, this device keep dissconneting from the WiFi, called supports, they suggested to buy WiFi extender, DID THAT, returned them all Becouse none of them helped. then I relocated the device 5-6 feet away from the router and still same thing!!!! Called them and they stay clueless with no additional advise, SHAME ON YOU AND UR PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nick

customer_reviews.title: It is not very "Smart", lawn looks like garbage
customer_reviews.text: No matter what I do, the "Smart" watering system does not function properly. Leaving it run as smart watering for 1 month caused only 2 out of the 4 zones to be watered and that was 24 days apart! It will over-water Zone 1, running it for 55 minutes, then completely ignore the other 3 zones for weeks. I should have spent the extra money and got the Rachio.
customer_reviews.author: Brad_VA

customer_reviews.title: Really glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I waited this long to upgrade! Very easy set up, user friendly app, and great features. I installed it myself. Took photos as I took apart the old one, and then followed instructions on the new one. I’m a handy, but technologically challenged female. It took me a little bit of trial and error dialing into a perfect watering schedule, but now, it’s on it’s own and my grass has never looked better. My water bill is the lowest I can remember for this time of the year. I probably saved about 25% in a month of July. Houston water prices are no joke, and this will pay for itself in the next couple of month.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Better than my Hunter Pro-C
customer_reviews.text: So I use to have a Hunter Pro-C irrigation timer, and let me tell you....the thing was like rocket science trying to program the zones. I would literally have to watch a 20 minute YouTube video on how to program it, every time I wanted to change the grass watering (about 3 times a year). This orbit WiFi timer is a game changer.....SO EASY to program everything using the Apple/android app....probably took me 2 minutes into total. Only con with this is that I needed to hardwire the power cord and it didn’t come with the adapter I needed to make the wire fit around the screw....if you have a standard wall plug you won’t need to worry about this.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very good product but has some issues
customer_reviews.text: The main controller works fine except it disconnects after one or two days from Wi-Fi which is a known problem and hasn't been fixed for a couple of years which I don't understand. I solved it thanks to advice from the forums, I connected a separate timer which disconnects power for one minute every 24 hours and resets Wi-Fi connection . I ordered three hose controllers and one of them failed immediately after one day , got a replacement which works fine so far . Overall everything is fine but quality control and software issues should be resolved after producing this line for a few years. I will add more observations over time.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great sprinkler controller with app
customer_reviews.text: Installed my previous controller and had wires labelled made installation easier. Once installed, it's proved to be a great controller especially with being able to control via the phone app. Do have a TP Link wifi mesh in my house to ensure I can keep a constant wifi connection to this controller. After 30 days with this new controller, really like the app and biggest feature I like is that it monitors local weather and will delay the if rain is in the area (app will notify you via phone and can be over-written via the app if needed). Overall, great controller and being able to control remotely.
customer_reviews.author: O. Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Total step up from what I had before
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing compared to the old device I had. I can ask Alexa to turn on a zone for me now which is much easier than walking all the way back to the controller. I can also schedule from my phone and control when my yard is watered based on the likelihood that it is going to rain. Plenty of other functions come with this that I don't mess with. Definitely recommend. Don't forget to download the app to use it.
customer_reviews.author: DWB

customer_reviews.title: Best customer service around
customer_reviews.text: This review is nearly a year after we bought it. I wasn't please with the timer, it never hooked up to phone right and seemed to have one issue after another. While trying to fix a setting we called customer service. They simply asked when we bought it and mailed us a replacement. We should have done that months ago! They didn't ask for us to dig for paperwork about when we bought it or anything! Just apologized and Fed ex'd us a replacement. The new one is amazing! I had no idea when I was missing. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: T. Pen

customer_reviews.title: Easy iphone integration and easy to program from the app
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this purchase. It is all the way on the other side of my garage away from my wifi, yet it still connects with no problem. I have never even touched the user interface to program it, since all the programming can be done easily through the iphone app. This system even monitors local weather and if rain is impending will delay the watering by zone for 24 hours. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: bherch

customer_reviews.title: 2 years in- I’m loving it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid sprinkler management system. I love that I can turn zones on and off with my phone from anywhere! The app is pretty good and still seems to be improving. The ability to set multiple programs is awesome. It helps me to remember which watering programs have worked well for me. BHyve is at its best when I’m working on fixing sprinkler rotations or fixing problems- no more running back and forth to a box to turn zones on and off. My family appreciates not being forced into button pushing duty! Half the price of some of the other systems out there!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Slick machine
customer_reviews.text: I installed inside. WiFi works great setup was easy. Been very happy with it. Have more to learn about it but like a lot of the features. Especially that zones are marked with images so I know exactly what I am watering. Only annoying thing is it updates you multiple times a day if rain is detected or on forecast. Once would be enough. But I just turned that off for now until I figure it all the way out. I am using 11 zones.
customer_reviews.author: TheHuff109

customer_reviews.title: Best irrigation smart controller ever
customer_reviews.text: I live this controller so much I sold my house and left it for the new owner, turned around and bought a new one for my new place. Photos of each irrigation zone that you take on your phone and paste into the app is really cool. Being able to work on your sprinkler heads with your phone in your hand turning on and off zones as you need is so handy. Keeps an eye on the weather forecast for the week and sends an alert to your phone letting you know the controller has paused all watering for 24 hours. App is so simple and complete you never have to touch the controller again. Absolutely must have irrigation controller.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Has to be manually power cycled if power outage or internet interruption occurs
customer_reviews.text: The major problem for me, is that if your internet ever gets interrupted, or a brief power outage occurs, the controller has to be manually reset. I wanted to use this for a vacation home 600 miles away. With no one at the home, this controller is useless. With a power outage, the controller will immediately try to reconnect. The problem is that a modem takes 3-5 minutes to reboot. By that time the controller stops trying to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Major manufacturer quality but lacking some functionality
customer_reviews.text: The good. All in one box suitable for mounting outdoors. Does great controlling the sprinklers. Scheduling and zone control is intuitive. The bad. As near as I can tell this device isn’t set up to do manual watering. When you open a zone in the app it has no on/off button. Instead, you have to tap test, and set a run time. I have yard hydrants that are on a valve, so I need to do this all the time and it’s annoying. This isn’t HomeKit compatible. I so badly want to be able to say “Hey Siri turn on my hydrants” instead of tapping through the interface on my phone or walking to the control box.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy install ans
customer_reviews.text: I researched several wifi enabled sprinkler controller and decided on the b-hyve based on the reviews and price. First of all I justvwanted to emphasize on the ease of setting this system, it was simply plugging in the system and following the instruction on the app. Once connected, it took jist a fee minutes to set up the smart watering schedule amd the system assisted on keeping you informed on the steps your in. So far no issues and I would recommend it for the simplicity of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good App, Bad Basics
customer_reviews.text: The concept of this product is fantastic and the mobile app actually works quite well. However, the unit that I have doesn't work out of manual mode from the actual controller. So without turning on an entire program or using my app, I can't simply turn on one zone at a time from the box. I don't carry my phone when I'm working in the yard for many reasons so the convenience this was supposed to bring...did not. Perhaps mine is faulty or there's a mystery setting I'm missing but I haven't been able to get in touch with Orbit though I've tried several times already.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Sbalbi

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this timer—Orbit FAIL!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this time however within two weeks it would randomly disconnect from the WiFi and require power cycling it. Sometimes it would reconnect other times not, This appears to be a known issue to orbit. When it worked it was fantastic but when the Wi-Fi stopped pairing it becomes just like any other dumb timer and not worth the money. Of course when this happens you can’t use the greatest feature of this timer which is remotely control the sprinkler valves—-orbit fail!! Until Orbit gets the firmware updated save yourself the grief don’t get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High tech irrigation.
customer_reviews.text: If you are using a well you need to use an orbit pump start relay. I had a Hunter pump relay and it wasn’t compatible. Once I changed to the orbit pump start relay all was well. The B-hyve WiFi timer works well but the thing I love about it is the manual function. You can change out a sprinkler head and by using your phone turn on the zone and adjust it without running into your garage to turn it on or off. A great aggravation saver. There are many more fine tuning adjustments on the B-hyve to make the most discriminating yard man happy. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Grosso

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for Hunter model
customer_reviews.text: Was an easy drop in replacement for a 90's hunter digital model I used. There were 3 extra wires that it took some googling (and a rachio support group) to determine were no longer needed with the bhive (in mine they were red white and blue and went to the power block of the old hunter). I left these out and only plugged up the common (white) and the 5 sprinkler wires and it worked immediately and i test/mapped each zone and added a picture to the app! Very happy, I had it scheduled to run last night and when I awoke it hadn't but noted that rain was coming today so it didn't need to.
customer_reviews.author: SimpsonsTX

customer_reviews.title: Good product don't buy from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived with a broken led screen. Don't buy this product on Amazon. I did go buy a new one at a brick and mortar and am very happy so far. The main reason I bought this is to be able to manually run my sprinklers from the controller while also beimg able to control via WiFi. This does both. The app works fine and scheduling is easy. You can't beat this for the price. 3 stars because it came broken
customer_reviews.author: Amazon-SPW

customer_reviews.title: Good product and priced right
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I wasn't to sure about this unit. Now, that I have learned how to work it it does the job very well. I Wasn't getting my notifications at first when it was done watering. I simply turned the notifications on off button a few times and it reset itself. I recommend this product for the price, quality and ease of use. I am not a very good handyman and I was able to install this unit easily. It takes about 15 minutes. I simply took a picture of the wire install from my manual orbit and installed the wires the same way. It worked perfect the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Arney

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Finally decided it was time to replace our sprinkler control box that was installed when our house was built in 1994, and so glad we chose this one. We did a lot of research and decided this was the best option to go with. It was fairly easy to install and get up and running. This morning we woke up to rain and right from bed we were able to turn off the sprinklers - no more sprinting to the garage to shut it off. Also, this qualified for a 50% rebate from our local water municipality because it’s a smart product (and will help save water). Definitely work looking into.
customer_reviews.author: capricorn vegetarian

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to program with the app
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and very straightforward to set up using the B-hyve app. My previous valve controller was twenty years old and I could only choose preprogrammed water settings. With the B-hyve I can customize every aspect of watering days and times for each zone, easily and simply from my kitchen table! The app is very simple to navigate and so far the valve controller is working flawlessly. Chose the Orbit over other wireless controllers based on the reviews of how simple it is to navigate the programming and I am very pleased with the orbit B-hyve
customer_reviews.author: csb

customer_reviews.title: Two years of use...waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: After using this for now two years, I wouldn’t buy this junk again. When it is online it is nice to cycle and test zones remotely. However it loses connectivity once a day, at least. So I have to go out and power cycle it and it reconnects. I have a mesh network and my Ring devices further out never disconnect and my BHyve always says full WiFi signal. Oh and if you want to try to get service or update, you have to post your MAC address to a forum and someone may eventually push an update. Not sure who else to go with, but don’t buy this junk.
customer_reviews.author: TxMan

customer_reviews.title: Best sprinkler controller EVER  SO EASY and cool features you control with your phone
customer_reviews.text: Best buy value for features , ease of install and just plain COOL. 1. The price was pretty good compared to others 2. The product is very well made with a great outdoor case, easy to read screen and pretty easy to navigate on screen. 3. Install was straight forward and once on my WiFi network, the app configured all of my stations and dates and times and duration in about 4 minutes!!!. 4. The app has a great ability to manually control any station at any time on a whim in 1 minute while you are sitting in the living room. 5 STARS... none better. I am so happy.
customer_reviews.author: SprinterVanMan

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your time - WIFI FEATURE DOESN'T WORK
customer_reviews.text: This Controller works but the whole reason I bought it was for the smart phone app. THIS DOESN'T WORK WELL AT ALL!! 1. The controller was an ABCD controller but didn't come with ABCD instructions. 2. The video that the support team kept pushing me to watch, over and over, was not the ABCD video and made no sense for my application. 3. The app for the PRO costs $10 4. The app called B-Hyve light doesn't work 5. The app called B-Hyve is the only one that worked for my application but didn't pick up a wifi signal even though my modem and router are within 10 feet of the controller. DON'T DO IT MAN! DON'T DO IT.....
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Soooo convenient
customer_reviews.text: It was hard for me to spend the money to replace a working sprinkler controller (that didn't have wi-fi). I finally got fed up with running to the garage to turn the system on or off when making adjustments. This solved that problem and made it where I don't mind occasionally checking the system to make sure each zone is working well. I hadn't thought about it but being able to adjust the programs on my iphone instead of having to stand at the control box with clunky analog controls is a major bonus to going wi-fi. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: The sprinkler is great for the money and althought there are other brands with better app experience this will do the same but it will takes more clicks to get to the setting you are looking for. Installation took about 10 mins after removing the old one and app setting took about 5 more minutes. Very easy to install and app can use some work for better flow to an amazing user experience.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro N.

customer_reviews.title: Love this controller
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to set up, program and connect to Wi-Fi. It took literally maybe 5 minutes. I love that I receive notifications on my phone when watering is completed, and that I can also turn zones on and off manually from my phone as needed. Extra bonus regarding notifications: I received an email that the controller had been off for 24 hours. Since it's plugged into the same outlet as my septic system aerator, this is serious. Turns out the GFI had tripped and if it hadn't been for the B-Hyve letting me know I could have had a major problem!
customer_reviews.author: Picky Girl

customer_reviews.title: Useful Smart Device
customer_reviews.text: I think some of these "smart devices" are just a way to get consumers to spend more money but I think having a smart sprinkler timer is very helpful. Setting it up was a little time consuming but easy. I like how you can take pictures of each zone. I use the smart watering feature so it just does whatever it wants to do. I've added watering restrictions (only watering even days) which the system follows. You can also adjust the times that the timer automatically calculates. It's helpful that if you want to check a zone that is far from the sprinkler box, you can just activate it with your phone instead of running to the box and back.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Major connectivity bugs after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year, unit frequently loses connection and leaves our garden unwatered for days before we receive an alert. Have manually reconnected to WiFi each time to no avail. Checked for firmware upgrade hoping to fix it, but none is available. I’d steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Sometimes I buy things, and sometimes I'm happy with my purchases, but other times I am not...

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Features, Came Defective
customer_reviews.text: This sprinkler timer has a lot of great smart features for automatically scheduling watering. The app works great and very intuitively. I love the ability to customize each zone regarding plant types, soil conditions and slope, etc, in order to get a customized watering schedule. Setup was easy, and could be done using both the app and the front panel controls. Unfortunately I had to call the manufacturer to replace mine because one zone wire clamp would slip loose. The pictures on Amazon show the Gen 1 model - I received the Gen 2.
customer_reviews.author: rjk

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this controller to replace a 10 year old R-bird controller which was still working perfectly, but lacked the wi-fi and remote features. Installation was a breeze. Prior to removing the old controller, I marked the wires according to their zones, since I have 12, and there were doubles of each color. The phone app gives you the option to take a photo of each zone which makes it simple to program and now I can control individual zones on demand, or let the programs run as I have them set. I would buy this again if the need was there.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G. - Dallas,Tx.

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, great customer support
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old Toro irrigation controller. I worried that it would be challenging to re-wire, but I just used masking tape to label the wires in the old controller and then attached then in the correct order to the new one an it was a breeze. I did have a problem with the first unit. It stopped working but when i called the manufacturer, the answered promptly, listened and immediately offered to send a new one without the hassle of sending the defective unit back. Great customer support!
customer_reviews.author: Conrad2k

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm really happy with my B-Hyve. Alexa integration needs fine-tuning, but works well when using the precise wording. I had to get the exact commands from the interwebs. I printed them out, and now all is fine. It accesses the forecast via Wi-Fi, and sets an automatic rain delay when necessary Love being able to set a "rain delay" for X amount of days if I don't want the yard watered for a while. You can set it for odd/even date watering for communities with rationing conditions, or set it for specific days of the week. Programming is easy using the phone app. One of my favorite purchases of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Sooner

customer_reviews.title: B-Hyve 12 station Irrigation controller
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the easy order, on time delivery, packaged well, this unit was a breeze. Installation took twenty one minutes from unboxed to programmed. Installation time included removing the old manual control rainbird (relic from the Arc), relocating the mounting screws to align with my wiring harness. Down loaded the app, load the MAC address into router, connect, set station, test and set program. It started as programmed and worked perfect. I looked at more expensive units that had more features that I determined I really didn't need. This unit the Orbit 57950 B-hyve Smart Indoor/Outdoor 12-Station WiFi Sprinkler System Controller is the best bang for the buck in my view.
customer_reviews.author: Rattler77

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, works great.
customer_reviews.text: Guys I am really happy with how easy this was to install. I have never installed an outside timer before and was a little hesitant. But this guy was a breeze. I do feel I’m pretty handy and I took my time and followed the instructions closely. That being said it went really well on the first try. The timer works great and I love being able to program from the app. The application is simple also. I will update this review if I have any issues but for now I do recommend this this timer.
customer_reviews.author: TQ

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase from Amazon Warehouse.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a lot of stuff from Amazon Warehouse in the past and have been pleased. This time, however, I was very disappointed. I plugged the sprinkler controller into a known good outlet but the display screen continued to reflect "NO AC PWR." Upon further inspection, it was obvious that the power supply had been opened (the housing was misaligned). In spite of an attempted repair, the power supply was not sending power to the sprinkler control PCB. Amazon Warehouse quality control - FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: KaptSlo

customer_reviews.title: UsefulWorks especially well for my system.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this unit. Works well with Alexa and phone although you can’t edit a program except at the unit. Easy to install and use. Works especially well for my system. We have about 80 sprinkler heads & drip emitters. Our well has lots of iron that often plugs sprinkler head filters. With my old controller I had to: 1. Walk to controller and turn on station to check which heads were plugged. 2. Walk to controller to turn off. 3. Remove sprinkler head filter. 4. Walk to controller to flush iron out. 5. Replace filter. 6. Etc. etc. etc. Now I can do all this with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice interface and WiFi app control is awesome but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this irrigation timer based on the recommendation from a friend. I had my landscaper install it and while the install was smooth the unit I received was defective. When I turned on 1 valve, it would turn on all valves. We were never able to get it to turn on separate valves independently. We verified all the connections numerous times and determined that this unit must've been the dud of the lot. I can say that the interface on the app is really good and intuitive. I wish it had worked but I ended up getting a higher quality/commercial level timer (Rainbird) which worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: bigc97

customer_reviews.title: Works great, sorry I waited to replace old timer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old timer with bad dial/buttons. B-hyve works great, replacement was easy. Programming easier to do with the phone. Easier to test zones without going back to the controller. I'm surprised at how well auto programming does . UI and some features could be improved (notifications that watering is starting tonight , not just completed, auto delay more than 24 hrs after heavy rain), but overall I'm very pleased. Wish I did it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: R. Eden

customer_reviews.title: Great timer.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I just replaced a 15 year old Rain Bird timer that was so outdated. I was able to transfer the wires over and it worked like a charm! I love the phone app. I can control my sections from my phone. No more stumbling out to the garage and climbing over things to turn on and off the sprinkler system. When I took the old timer off, it actually fell apart...the knob had finally fallen off. I think it was time. It didn't take me long to install it either. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: boggydawggy

customer_reviews.title: Sprinkler is not working with timer
customer_reviews.text: The app keep saying watering complete but the sprinkler itself is never activated and the soil is bone dry. Even the app says soil humidity is 0. I reset it couple of times and reprogram it but he problem still exist. It’s not working. It doesn’t activate the sprinkler. Very expensive useless piece of f sprinkler. Customer support always busy
customer_reviews.author: unicorn1667

customer_reviews.title: A phenomenal timer that is worth the effort to connect to your wifi!
customer_reviews.text: I love this timer NOW that it is online! With two acres, I was always running back and forth to the garage to turn off a zone when I saw a leak, fix it, and thyen have to go back up to turn it back on. Now it's all controlled by phone. Installation was easy. JUST BE PATIENT CONNECTING TO YOUR WIFI. You can see from the reviews that the connection is not always as straightforward as connecting the zone wires. Mine said "No WiFi detected" initially but then it allowed me to test my first zone! I called tech support and thyey were great. I can't think that any timer costing more could be better!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Programming is much easier through the app
customer_reviews.text: The app makes programming a lot easier than standing in the flower bed endlessly pushing the arrows up and down until all 12 zones are programmed. The smart features and rain sensor are great features. It gets weather forecasting over the internet and will delay watering if the forecast says rain is eminent, or the sensor has detected rain. Installation was easy - I took a picture of the old Hunter timer this replaced, to capture which wires went to which terminals on the blocks, and moved them over to this new Orbit timer. Recommend it highly!
customer_reviews.author: Miles B. Free

customer_reviews.title: Very easy system to navigate
customer_reviews.text: The unit is very easy to install and the app is nice as well. Programing is a breeze. It is so easy to set up the watering days and times in accordance with our cities mandates. The flexibility of watering changes due to weather conditions is nice. I do like the fact that you can customize your zones with pictures. For me the best feature is: I can turn zones on and off, while inspecting my lines and sprinkler heads. With out having to run in and out of my garage, to the wall unit.
customer_reviews.author: KellyH

customer_reviews.title: Paring Can Be An Issue
customer_reviews.text: Hey folks..just want to share that Amazon is sending out older models of the Bhyve and you may experience challenges paring to your phone. Apparently, it has something to do with having either a GEN 1 and GEN 2 model. The Orbitz representative I spoke with stated that he is unable to determine what GEN model I had because the model number because the model number is the same for both. Orbitz does not work Saturdays during the the Fall and Winter seasons, so if you work 8-5 hours.. this can be a problem when trying to get assistance from a real person. Anywho, they did offer to send me printed help sheets..we'll see how this goes.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.  Easy, easy, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Our old sprinkler system controller was starting to misbehave so I bought this one to replace it. I love the fact that I can turn on and off the sprinklers from my phone. In the reviews, there was some discussion related to connecting 5G and consistent connection to wireless. I have had it installed for about 12 weeks now and it stays connected and it connected to my 5G network. I was able to install it in about 45 minutes. Connection to my network was easy and fast. It is also easy to set up the program for each zone. Love the wireless product. I should have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The product is fantastic. Very easy to set up and the app interface is perfect. It will automatically suspend a watering cycle when it has rained or rain is forecasted. That feature doesn't work that well, or maybe the software is just relying on weather forecasts and we all know those are not the most reliable. I will buying a second unit to put at a rental house so I can monitor the usage and tell it to throw in an extra watering cycle if I think it is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Fred R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Pro :Easy to install , WiFi connects great , App on iPhone Con: app takes 45 sec to 90 sec to connect , it relies on local weather to postpone watering , so you might go a week with no water and it never rained at yr house ! The deal breaker for me , unable to water just one zone without answering at least 8 questions, spent 3 hours working with app , tech support puts you on a 10 min hold then after 10 min tells you no help available today ! Not user friendly for me !
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fit needs for both techies and old fashions
customer_reviews.text: Fit needs for both techies and old fashions We bought this because the price seems reasonable, easy to install/setup, and ... we are lazy. When it became too troublesome going to the garage for managing the watering tasks, we knew it’s time to find something that we could just ask Alexa to do it or manage the tasks using the smartphone app. Just in case we want to plays with the panels and push the buttons, we can still do it! The settings require lots of details (soil type, shade, grade, plant type, sprinkler count and type, etc.) though.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy JST

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to install and configuring
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow! Only have it for a week now but am loving it so far. Extremely easy to install and configuring, took approx. 30 min to setup a 7 zone sprinkler system. You can control everything from a touch of your mobile device. No more running to the controller to test or start certain zone when troubleshooting an/or just to give it a bit more watering time. This was recommended from our neighbors and I would in turn recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L

customer_reviews.title: Wifi great, app great, manual works too!
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted a smart sprinkler system controller that we could operate manually if needed. We are very happy with this unit! It works great, zones were easy to input, connecting to our wi-fi was easy - if you have a dual band router, make sure to connect to the lower band if possible. This helps with connectivity as it works at longer ranges. We get alerts if it is going to rain and also if the unit loses its wi-fi connection - which has happened only once, and only because I disconnected it. We would recommend this unit to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: My Garden Haven

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This was a very easy setup for 4 zones and a small greenhouse. Just connected wires and plugged in unit. The app was easy to navigate and explained each step. Turning off 1 zone was easy. I like the 4th program option and it tracks weather for my zip code. Soil and plant types could use work when setting up smart options. Adding specific green house specs and options would be nice, as well as mixed plant types in large flower beds. When setting a program time would be nice to allow 2 watering times per day on same program. Overall seems to be better than my old Toro exact timer.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great product that doesn't support those with wifi band steering
customer_reviews.text: product is awesome and support is great. Unfortunately I can't use it as my wifi setup uses band steering [combining 2.4 and 5ghz into single ssid]. Company calls it mash network which is not supported as per support either. Mesh network and band steering are not same thing though.
customer_reviews.author: I.D.

customer_reviews.title: extremely handy smart phone app--no more going outside to the controller
customer_reviews.text: This controller has a very good phone app that allows you to completely control the irrigation system from your couch. It is extremely easy to program and use. You can setup multiple different programs in case you only want to water part of your yard on a given day, and it also has multiple time settings for each program. I really like the ability to run a 'test' of an individual zone without turning on an entire program. It has a 'rain' function that will adjust your watering schedule, but my weather is way too unpredictable for this function to work well for me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: B-HYVE IS 5G, not all Rachio is 5G
customer_reviews.text: I am changing my product review. Was a bigger fan of Rachio than B-HYVE until now. I had a Rachio Gen 1 and Gen 2. Both became outdated with software and WiFi issues. I now have 2 Orbit B-HYVE timers. The price is right, costs almost half as much. Works most of the time pretty well. Not as "smart" as Rachio with weather stuff but a working unit is better than a non- working outdated unit.
customer_reviews.author: 84fordltd

customer_reviews.title: Seems good if the app is any indication
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble with the installation. Called customer service for help. They were helpful but found that the unit did not replace my Hunter irrigation timer. This was not stated in the literature, so be diligent in your research. I suggest you take a look at the Utube installation guides that are online to make sure the wiring on your timer matches up with the Orbit timer. OR call the manufacturer to make sure the Orbit can upgrade your system.
customer_reviews.author: CWStew

customer_reviews.title: BEST irrigation timer ever!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Setup was incredibly easy and the app is beautiful. I love that it stores photos of the areas that each station controls. It stores 4 different programs (one for each season), has smart watering or strict program options, comes with more stations and at a lower price than any other WiFi timers I've seen. And I've researched A LOT. Remotely turning stations on/off from my cell phone is SOOOOOOOOOO convenient for checking irrigation integrity and proper distribution. It has made maintaining my drip systems so so much easier (those crappy adjustable drippers are always breaking!). Can't recommend this timer enough!
customer_reviews.author: Westin S

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine back in 2017 and by far one of the cheapest and easiest to operate on the market. The app is great and easy to navigate. Took me about an hour to swap out the old with the new. I recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: FrozenOzone

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with this. Super value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new house that came with a two zone sprinkler system. The controller was a basic Hunter unit with a rotary dial, buttons, small lcd screen and no ability to connect remotely. After two months of fooling with this, frustration drove me to seek other options. The bhive checked all the boxes for options I wanted at a price point you cannot ignore. It was easy to install, up and running in less than 30 minutes. In smart watering mode, you set the start time you want and it watches weather at your location only watering when needed. I love this thing. In a time where products often under deliver... this was truly a great buying experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gjamendola

customer_reviews.title: Orbit 57950 B-hyve Smart Indoor/Outdoor WiFi Sprinkler Controller
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation, worked right out of the box! Hint: while the device is on its way after you order it, set-up your account (email address and password) that way you’ll be 1 step ahead of installation. Always take a picture of your old sprinkler attached wires (A). Old sprinkler unit on top of new Orbit system (B). New Orbit system (C). First time connecting to WiFi without a single issue!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install / setup
customer_reviews.text: This thing was very easy to setup & install. WARNING - if you have a "master" valve it has to be wired to the "pump" terminal. The orbit tech support batted 50% on this question. The only thing I did not like was the power cable does not connect in the controller (hard wired). If you have a power wire fed thru a hole you will have to change it or cut & splice the wire. Should have bought this long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McLean

customer_reviews.title: Too "smart" for its own good
customer_reviews.text: Installed for 3 weeks now. It has not watered even 1 time. It believed it had a rain sensor that was never installed or configured and it cancelled the programming for "rain delay". Now it believes the temperature is low at night - in Central Florida in March, the lows are in the 60s - and so it has "freeze delay". All smart features are turned off. Found hidden function - on the controller, not available via the app - to disable the rain sensor. It's a frickin' sprinkler timer - it shouldn't be this difficult to configure and use. A $5 mechanical timer is "smarter" than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: FLDills

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to use this, since I am "old school" and haven't used much smart technology, but my son kind of talked me into it. The software is extremely easy to use and I haven't had one glitch in the system since it was set up. He set it up for me in just a few minutes. I was concerned about the WiFi connection since it's in the basement and guests have had trouble connecting from down there, but it connects with no problem. I can't speak to the Alexa integration because I don't use Alexa, but I would expect it to work well with it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Veretto

customer_reviews.title: The BEST out there Super cool
customer_reviews.text: This IMO is the best system controller ever. User friendly. Easy to setup and operate if you choose so. It sends updates when it’s done to my phone. I can test the sprinkler heads while standing at the zone. The zone set up is EASY and I can add pictures of each zone to remind me if I forget which zone is which. It’s reliable, no need to worry if it’s going to work as scheduled. Forgot to stop watering while I was away from my home and I got a freeze warning; so while I was away I changed my watering- super cool.
customer_reviews.author: P2

customer_reviews.title: Cloud Wifi is great!
customer_reviews.text: I put one of these in at my camp where I have a DSL wifi router mounted outside in a box and it works perfectly every time! I can look at my grass with my wifi security cameras and see if I need to turn on my sprinkler system for a set period of time, or I can put it on a schedule and do it automatically. I still have not hooked up a hygrometer but that is next. I have used this for a year now and it works without a hitch. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris P. Singletary

customer_reviews.title: Great controller!
customer_reviews.text: I love this sprinkler controller! So easy to set up and work from the phone. My husband did the install and he thought that was straightforward even with outr 9 station system. He plans to add one more so we can add water to the pool by remote also. We haven't connected it to our google home yet but I love just seeing it on the phone- I have a picture for each zone and have been showing it to my neighbors. The sale price of $90 was outstanding- I would have paid full price for this one.
customer_reviews.author: DGS

customer_reviews.title: Have to log on every time...ARRRRGGGHHH.
customer_reviews.text: Nice for the price. Installation was easy. Had to cut the transformer cord to hard wire. Set up is super easy. The only thing I don't like and why it is 4 stars is the app. Requires log on each time, even if the phone screen times out. Pain in the ***. Otherwise, I love it. *****UPDATE***** So after I write this review the app keeps me logged in so changing to 5 stars. I guess the squeaky wheel does get the grease!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Bad product description-be warned it may not replace your existing system
customer_reviews.text: Does not put out enough power to operate a pump relay switch. Apparently, this happens quite often but they don’t bother to give us advance warningBefore selling the unit or with the installation instructions. Meanwhile, I wasted a whole lot of time wiring and then on wiring the unit.
customer_reviews.author: ATM

product_meta.description: Size:6 Station| Pattern Name:Sprinkler ControllerAdding to their legacy of top-of-line sprinkler timers, Orbit is pleased to announce the addition of their most intuitive, feature-rich timer to date. The Orbit B-hyve Smart WiFi Sprinkler Controller is made in the USA with global materials. The perfect timer for new installations or for replacement, it is available in both 6 and 12 station models with indoor/outdoor-rated locking cabinet. Control it with an Android or iOS device, computer, or at the timer with the super-intuitive interface millions of customers know and love. WaterSense and SWAT labeling provide assurance that B-hyve uses advanced weather data to deliver just the right amount of water to plants and turf, and postpones watering whenever rain is in the forecast. The Orbit B-hyve Smart WiFi Sprinkler Controller makes saving water, time and money easier than ever.
feature_bullets: ULTIMATE WIFI AND TIMER CONTROL - The B-hyve app is fully functional for Android, iOS or web devices and gives you control wherever you need it. Program your timer on the app, at the timer, or let the weather-based software create a program for you.

SMART WATERING - Weather Sense technology provides watering based on site conditions such as slope, soil type, sun/shade, historical ET and live weather feeds. It automatically adjusts your controller to deliver the right amount of water to your plants.

EASY TO INSTALL AND USE - Utilize the swing panel for easy access to the angled wiring terminals, which makes wiring simple and convenient and the plug-and-go line cord that can also be cut for hardwired applications.

CERTIFIED TO SAVE WATER AND MONEY - B-hyve is EPA WaterSense approved and certified, ensuring it will save you water and energy. This can also make your B-hyve timer eligible for local rebates, which can save up to 100% of the cost on your timer.

DURABILITY AND SECURITY - The Orbit B-hyve Wi-Fi sprinkler timer comes in a weather-resistant case, allowing you to mount your timer indoors or outdoors without risk of weather damage and a locking cabinet that keeps your timer safe from harm.

WATER SAVINGS - Integrate your B-hyve timer with use of Catch Cups (Orbit 26250) to save up to 50% more water than with traditional controllers. Optimize the way you water, so you can keep everything lush and green without breaking the bank.

VOICE CONTROL - Works with Amazon Alexa for voice control (Alexa device sold separately). Visit help.orbitbhyve.com/alexa-commands/ for a quick guide on how you can use your B-hyve with Alexa to control your watering with a simple phrase.
USE WITH 110V ONLY - Compatible and compliant only with North American electrical outlets. International versions are available for markets outside North America.
